steps.title: Wash your hands before and after applying the gel.
steps.content: Wash your hands before and after applying the gel. Use soap and water to wash your hands before applying the gel to the desired area. Once you’ve rubbed the gel into your skin, wash your hands again to get the excess gel off. [2] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source If you’re applying the gel to your hands, you don’t need to wash them off after applying Voltaren, but do make sure your hands are dry before putting the gel on.

steps.title: Follow the directions on your prescription label.
steps.content: Follow the directions on your prescription label. Your doctor should have given you specific instructions for applying the gel, especially when it comes to the dosage amount. [3] X Expert Source Meera Subash, MD Board Certified Rheumatologist Expert Interview. 5 February 2021. If your doctor gave you individualized instructions for how to apply the gel, follow their directions to make sure you're using the gel safely. [4] X Research source If your doctor didn’t give you specific instructions, read the label on the Voltaren Gel’s container for additional directions. Don’t change your dosage without talking to your doctor.

steps.title: Use the dosing card to measure the correct dose of gel.
steps.content: Use the dosing card to measure the correct dose of gel. Voltaren Gel comes with a dosing card to help you apply the correct amount. [5] X Expert Source Meera Subash, MD Board Certified Rheumatologist Expert Interview. 5 February 2021. Use the rectangular area to measure out the dosage to the 2 g (0.071 oz) or 4 g (0.14 oz) line. You’ll squeeze out the gel inside the rectangular area, being careful to stick to the right measurements. [6] X Research source If you’re applying the gel to your upper extremities (elbow, wrist, or hand), then you’ll apply 2 g (0.071 oz). If you’re applying the gel to your lower extremities (knee, ankle, or foot), apply 4 g (0.14 oz). Make sure your skin is clean and dry before applying the gel to the affected area. Use the dosing card each time you apply the gel.

steps.title: Rub the gel over the affected area gently.
steps.content: Rub the gel over the affected area gently. Once you’ve applied the right amount, start rubbing the gel into your skin. Spread it out so that the gel is covering the entire area that’s in pain. [7] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source The gel should be rubbed into clean, dry skin. Avoid getting the gel in your eyes, nose, or mouth.

steps.title: Wait at least 10 minutes before putting clothing or gloves over the area.
steps.content: Wait at least 10 minutes before putting clothing or gloves over the area. This is to allow the gel to properly soak and dry into the skin. If you’re applying the gel to a part of your body that will be covered up by clothing, such as your knee or ankle, wait at least 10 minutes before getting dressed. [8] X Research source Avoid putting a bandage over the gel application as well.

steps.title: Let the gel application sit for at least 1 hour before washing.
steps.content: Let the gel application sit for at least 1 hour before washing. If you need to take a shower or bath, it’s important to apply the gel an hour before you need to wash. This lets it take full effect and not be washed off. [9] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source If the gel application is on your hands, wait an hour before washing the area on your hands.

steps.title: Avoid using the gel more than 4 times a day on one area.
steps.content: Avoid using the gel more than 4 times a day on one area. For your upper extremities, you shouldn’t use more than 8 g (0.28 oz) per day on the affected area. For lower extremities, you shouldn’t use more than 16 g (0.56 oz) per day. For example, if you’re applying the gel to your wrist, you can apply 2 g (0.071 oz) of the gel to your wrist 4 times each day. Don’t exceed 32 grams (1.1 oz) in one day.

steps.title: Use your discretion if you miss a dose.
steps.content: Use your discretion if you miss a dose. Try to apply the gel as soon as you remember that you missed a dose. However, if you missed a dose and it’s time for your next scheduled dose, don’t apply double the amount—just skip the missed dose and continue with your regular schedule. Ask your doctor or pharmacist if you have additional questions about how to handle a missed dose.

steps.title: Avoid applying Voltaren Gel to open wounds.
steps.content: Avoid applying Voltaren Gel to open wounds. If you have any cuts, infections, burns, or rashes, you shouldn’t apply the gel to these areas as it can irritate them or make them worse. Voltaren Gel is for soothing joint pain and won’t heal any open wounds. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Refrain from using cosmetics or other skin care products on the area.
steps.content: Refrain from using cosmetics or other skin care products on the area. The Voltaren Gel won’t work as well when it’s mixed with other products or if makeup is covering it up. When you apply the gel to an area, keep that area clean of any other products. [11] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source
